content:
There was still some troubleshooting advice at the bottom of Connection, so I've moved it to Test-Troublehshoot and edited it.

FIXMEs are still in multiple pages:
https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:set_options:connections
https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:set_options:connections:nmea2000
https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:set_options:connections:autopilot
https://opencpn.org/wiki/dokuwiki/doku.php?id=opencpn:manual_basic:set_options:connections:test-troubleshoot

Thanks John. I've made a github RFE as you suggested. I think we can delete the regex paragraph now.

Regarding the other pages, I too would like to know more about how AP work and I think this really needs to be clarified. I think we should invite some experts to advise so we get these questions answered and properly described in the Manual.

Great, I'll remove the Regex section. I finally bypassed my B&G GoFree router and used a Slate device. Suddenly I could use my iKommunicate Signalk gateway with OpenCPN! So maybe I can add a few setup details on that.
This sounds very interesting. We have an Old B&G Zeus 12 Touch with a B&G Radar which we like. Would be interested in iKommunicate SignalK. Maybe add a section under "Connect to SignalK"?

I don't have much to add that isn't already in the Connections section. I've yet to use the data stream, and the screen shot shows a bunch of unwanted / unneeded messages. I'm unclear at this time if the iKommunicate is useful, or just some boat candy.
Well, in any case, Steve seems to want it to be separate. See his comments here https://github.com/OpenCPN/OpenCPN/discussions/3776#discussioncomment-9556590

Yes, It IS confusing between Signal K Server and a hardware solution. That's why I tried to relabel the Signal K Server headings to make it clearer (not clear enough I guess). So I created a Connect To: Signal K - iKommunicate page and moved all that material there. Done, unless we want to add: sections for using iKommunicated with UDP or TCP outputs (why bother? OC allows Signal K). Or if we want to add different platforms that use different methods of address discovery (Android or Linux or RPI).

John what you have done is fine, but I wonder if this is a New User thing. Wouldn't it be better if we had this page under Connections right under the SignalK page? I've changed the underlying name of the page to make it a little smaller.

I'm fine with that - I don't have a strong feeling either way. I renamed Connections>Signal K to Connections>Signal K Server, which I think is more accurate and will differentiate it from Connections>SK - iKommunicate. I did the move.
